graphicslib3D

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Camera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICamera

    public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICamera
    Camera provides an implementation of the ICamera interface using the JOGL Java interface to OpenGL. The implementation maintains the attributes of the camera, but does not insure that those attributes are applied to the underlying OpenGL system; applying camera settings to OpenGL is the responsibility of external client code.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Camera()
      Constructs a Camera with a default set of attributes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera()
        Constructs a Camera with a default set of attributes. The default values for the camera are
        • location = (0,0,0)
        • U = {1,0,0}
        • V = {0,1,0}
        • N = {0,0,-1}
        • fovY = 45 degrees
        • aspect ratio = 1.0
        • near clipping plane distance = .01
        • far clipping plane distance = 100

    • Method Detail

      • getRightAxis

        public Vector3D getRightAxis()
        Returns a Vector3D giving the direction of the camera's right (U) axis. The returned Vector3D is a clone of the camera's U axis values; subsequent changes to the returned Vector3D have no effect on the camera.
        Specified by:
        getRightAxis in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        a Vector3D pointing in the direction of the camera's "right" axis.

      • getUpAxis

        public Vector3D getUpAxis()
        Returns a Vector3D giving the direction of the camera's up (V) axis. The returned Vector3D is a clone of the camera's V axis values; subsequent changes to the returned Vector3D have no effect on the camera.
        Specified by:
        getUpAxis in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        a Vector3D pointing in the direction of the camera's "up" axis.

      • getViewDirection

        public Vector3D getViewDirection()
        Returns a Vector3D giving the camera's view direction (N) axis. The returned Vector3D is a clone of the camera's N axis values; subsequent changes to the returned Vector3D have no effect on the camera.
        Specified by:
        getViewDirection in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        a Vector3D pointing in the direction of the camera's "view direction" axis.

      • getLocation

        public Point3D getLocation()
        Returns a Point3D giving the camera's location. The returned Point3D is a clone of the camera's location values; subsequent changes to the returned Point3D have no effect on the camera.
        Specified by:
        getLocation in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        a Point3D giving the camera's world location

      • setRightAxis

        public void setRightAxis(Vector3D right)
        Sets the camera's right (U) axis to the values in the specified Vector3D. The values are copied out of the specified Vector3D; subsequent changes to the specified Vector3D have no effect on the camera. Note that it is the client's responsibility to insure that camera axes remain mutually perpendicular.
        Specified by:
        setRightAxis in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        right - - the new camera "right" axis

      • setUpAxis

        public void setUpAxis(Vector3D up)
        Sets the camera's up (V) axis to the values in the specified Vector3D. The values are copied out of the specified Vector3D; subsequent changes to the specified Vector3D have no effect on the camera. Note that it is the client's responsibility to insure that camera axes remain mutually perpendicular.
        Specified by:
        setUpAxis in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        up - - the new camera "up" axis

      • setViewDirection

        public void setViewDirection(Vector3D viewDir)
        Sets the camera's view direction (N) axis to the values in the specified Vector3D. The values are copied out of the specified Vector3D; subsequent changes to the specified Vector3D have no effect on the camera. Note that it is the client's responsibility to insure that camera axes remain mutually perpendicular.
        Specified by:
        setViewDirection in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        viewDir - - the new camera "view direction" axis

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(Point3D loc)
        Sets the camera's location in world space to the values in the specified Point3D. The values are copied out of the specified Point3D; subsequent changes to the specified Point3D have no effect on the camera. The homogeneous (W) component of the camera location is set to 1.0 regardless of the W value in the specified Point3D.
        Specified by:
        setLocation in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        loc - - the new camera location

      • setAxes

        public void setAxes(Vector3D right,
                    Vector3D up,
                    Vector3D viewDir)
        A convenience method for setting all three of the camera's axes at the same time. The result of invoking this method is the same as invoking setRightAxis(), setUpAxis(), and setViewDirection() with the corresponding parameters. Note that it is the client's responsibility to insure that camera axes remain mutually perpendicular.
        Specified by:
        setAxes in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        right - - the new camera "right" (U) axis
        up - - the new camera "up" (V) axis
        viewDir - - the new camera "view direction" (N) axis

      • setPerspectiveFrustum

        public void setPerspectiveFrustum(double fovY,
                                  double aspect,
                                  double near,
                                  double far)
        Sets the camera perspective view frustum parameters to the specified values. Note that this method does not compute a perspective transformation matrix or apply it to the underlying graphics system; that is the responsibility of client code. This method simply saves the necessary parameters in the camera.
        Specified by:
        setPerspectiveFrustum in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        fovY - - the vertical (Y) angle of the frustum, in degrees
        aspect - - the aspect ratio (width/height) of the view frustum
        near - - the distance from the camera to the near clipping plane; must be > 0
        far - - the distance from the camera to the far clipping plane; must be > near
        See Also:
        ICamera.getPerspectiveFrustumSettings()

      • getPerspectiveFrustumSettings

        public double[] getPerspectiveFrustumSettings()
        Returns an array of doubles containing the camera field-of-view angle, aspect ratio, and near and far clipping plane values in elements [0] through [3] respectively of the returned array.
        Specified by:
        getPerspectiveFrustumSettings in interface ICamera
        Returns:
        - an array of doubles, where [0]=fovY, [1]=aspect ratio, [2]=near plane distance and [3]= far plane distance

      • pitch

        public void pitch(float degrees)
        Applies a pitch of the specified amount to the camera; that is, rotates the camera about its Right (U) axis by the specified amount in degrees.
        Specified by:
        pitch in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        degrees - - the amount of pitch to apply; a positive angle produces a counter-clockwise rotation about the camera's U axis.

      • yaw

        public void yaw(float degrees)
        Applies a yaw of the specified amount to the camera; that is, rotates the camera about its Up (V) axis by the specified amount in degrees.
        Specified by:
        yaw in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        degrees - - the amount of yaw to apply; a positive angle produces a counter-clockwise rotation about the camera's V axis.

      • roll

        public void roll(float degrees)
        Applies a roll of the specified amount to the camera; that is, rotates the camera about its view direction (N) axis by the specified amount in degrees.
        Specified by:
        roll in interface ICamera
        Parameters:
        degrees - - the amount of roll to apply; a positive angle produces a counter-clockwise rotation about the camera's N axis.

      • moveForward

        public void moveForward(float amount)
        Moves the camera forward (in the direction of its view; that is, in the direction of its N axis). The amount parameter controls how far to move; if amount is negative then the camera moves backward.
        Specified by:
        moveForward in interface ICamera

      • strafe

        public void strafe(float amount)
        Moves the camera left/right (along the direction of its U axis). The amount parameter controls how far to move; if amount is negative then the camera moves left; otherwise it moves right.
        Specified by:
        strafe in interface ICamera

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp(float amount)
        Moves the camera up/down (along the direction of its V axis). The amount parameter controls how far to move; if amount is negative then the camera moves down; otherwise it moves up.
        Specified by:
        moveUp in interface ICamera

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the camera to its default values as specified by the no-argument constructor.
